title: Chicago woman held on $1 million bond in man's death
title_page: Chicago woman held on $1 million bond in man's death | Daily Mail Online
text:
CHICAGO (AP) - A Chicago woman has been ordered held on $1 million bond for forcing her boyfriend to drink bleach, which killed him.
Prosecutors said during a Thursday bond hearing that Yasmine Elder and Darius Ellis were arguing in a van Monday but the argument turned physical and Elder got the upper hand.
Authorities say Elder grabbed Ellis' hair, pinned him down with her knees and poured the bleach on his face. Ellis ingested some of liquid, which the Cook County medical examiner says caused his death.
This undated photo provided by the Chicago Police Department shows Yasmine Elder. Elder has been ordered held on $1 million bond for forcing her boyfriend to drink bleach, leading to his death. Prosecutors said during a Thursday, March 9, 2017 bond hearing that Elder and Darius Ellis were arguing in a van Monday but the argument turned physical and Elder got the upper hand. (Chicago Police Department via AP)
Elder was arrested at her home. Authorities haven't said what prompted the fight.
